derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin captivitas, from captivus 'taken captive' (see captive)

entry.def: Captivity is the state of being kept imprisoned or enclosed.

example.ex: The great majority of barn owls are reared in captivity...
example.tran: 大多数仓鸮都是笼养的。

example.ex: An American missionary was released today after more than two months of captivity...
example.tran: 一位美国传教士在被关押两个多月后于今天获释。

sentences.sentence: "So every bondman in his own hand bears the power to cancel his captivity"--Shakespeare
